result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac Richard Tanner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
If Defendant completes probation and has no new law violations. Court finds society will not be harmed and defendant may petition the court for expungement.

No contact with Joshua or his residence.
No contact with child victim or his mother.
Follow all rules of affinity social worker.
Take all medications prescribed.
Follow all Doctor's orders.
Attend Anger management and any counseling deemed necessary.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

Case 14CF1017 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1099.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - 75 days credit. FORTHWITH. Last 90 days STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 236 days sentence credit.

AS OF 10-09-2015: COURT AMENDED CREDIT DAYS TO 252.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with Joshua or his residence.
No contact child victim or his mother.
Follow all rules of Affinity Social Worker.
Take all medications prescribed.
Follow all Doctor's orders.
Anger Management and any counseling deemed necessary.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

All Court costs/surcharges that were previously ordered are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Dated October 8, 2015 filed by the State responding to the Department of Corrections letter regarding sentence credit.  The State does not object to the request for 252 days of credit.
Filed with the State requesting they file a written response with the Court by 10/26/15 to the DOC's letter regarding sentence credit.
Dated October 2, 2015 filed by the Department of Corrections requesting the Court review the sentence credit granted by the Court.
Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Redetzke.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing hearing on revocation Ct. 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) commencing FORTHWITH. Credit for 236 days. 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- All fines/costs/restitution previously ordered remain 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: No contact with Joshua or his residence. No contact with Child victim or his mother. Follow all rules of affinity social worker. Take all medications prescribed. Follow all Doctor's orders. Angermanagement and any counseling deemed necessary.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/4/14 plea and sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Probation Revoked.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting another date. Defense just received a consolidated offer and needs to go over the plea forms. Court will set the matter over to 1:15 p.m. today. Case recalled at 11:05 a.m.. Parties are prepared to enter a plea and proceed to sentencing.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
-  Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: No contact with Joshua or his residence. No contact with Child victim or his mother. Follow all rules of affinity social worker. Take all medications prescribed. Follow all Doctor's orders. Angermanagement and any counseling deemed necessary.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 6 months jail Condition Time -  75 days credit  - forthwith -   last 90 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.


Defense reserves right to expungement.
State takes no position at this time. 
If defendant completes probation and has no new law violations, Court finds society will not be harmed and
defendant may petition the court for expungement.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wolff advised court defendant is no longer challenging competency. Court conducted colloquy with the defendant. Court found defendant competent to proceed.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.
from Dr. John Pankiewicz, M.D. from Wisconsin Forensic Unit.

for competency examination pursuant to Section 971.14(2), Wisconsin Statue, to be done by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff requests a competancy evaluation.    Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 15 days.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
